h2.span: Friday LEARNING Packet Drop Off & Pick Up

p.strong: This is a reminder that Friday mornings between 9:00 AM – 12:00 PM is our weekly drop-off and pick-up of distance learning packets. We will continue the drive-through process. Please pull up the first ramp to drop-off and pick-up your packet and then exit the far ramp. Also, Silver Graphics is extending its online ordering for our school until July 31, 2020, in case you would still like to place an order. I hope everyone is doing well and adjusting to all of the changes. If you have any questions, please contact the school office.

strong.mark: Upcoming Friday Learning Packet Drop Off & Pick Up Spirit Dates:

p.strong: Friday, May 15, 2020-Cougar Pride Spirit Day (Wear our Cougar Pride or Clear Creek shirts)

h2.span: Distance Learning Continues Remainder of School Year

p.strong: Please see the letter from Scott Lay, Superintendent of Schools. Due to the recent announcements made by both Tony Thurmond and Governor Newsom, all Nevada County schools will continue Distance Learning for the remainder of the school year. Our Clear Creek staff is working diligently to provide learning packets for our students. Although the campus is closed, we are all still here for you and your children. We will continue to distribute learning packets and review returned assignments. Teachers and office staff are available for your questions. Please continue to stay in touch with your child’s teacher and you can call or email the office anytime. Thank you all for your cooperation and understanding during this challenging time. I am wishing you all well and please take care of yourselves and your families.

h2.span: School Lunches available for all Students during distance learning

p.strong: Clear Creek School will provide an opportunity for families to drive through and pick up lunches for the children in their family, at our school site. Lunches will be provided by Central Kitchen, the same vendor that provides our daily school lunches. We will provide lunch for that day and breakfast for the following day. Lunches are available for pick up daily between 11 a.m. and 12 p.m at Clear Creek School. Please stay in your car.

In order to have lunch ready for pick-up, you will need to email lvaughan@clearcreekschool.org daily before 7:30 a.m. If you cannot email, you can call the school at 530-273-3664 to order also before 7:30 a.m.

This program will be solely for the pick-up of meals. Meals will not be consumed on-site. We encourage families to continue to be proactive in reducing the risk of COVID-19 by not congregating at the school site once meals have been distributed. Continue to wash your hands often, sneeze or cough into a tissue and stay home if you are sick.

div.p: The parent portal, ParentVUE, will give you access to realtime attendance, school messages, progress reports, report cards and other data about your child or children.

div.class: wp-block-atomic-blocks-ab-profile-box square ab-has-avatar ab-font-size-18 ab-block-profile ab-profile-columns

div.p: Greetings from the PTC and welcome to the 2019/2020 school year at Clear Creek! Please attend PTC’s monthly meetings on the second Tuesday of every month at 3 pm.

section.class: wp-block-uagb-columns uagb-columns__wrap uagb-columns__background-undefined uagb-columns__stack-mobile uagb-columns__valign-undefined uagb-columns__gap-10 alignundefined uagb-block-af5962f6-61de-4623-97cd-8bdda716fd08

div.p: Well, hello Clear Creek Community Members! This has been quite an interesting time for our school and our entire country. First, I want to say that I am wishing everyone well. The Clear Creek staff misses each of you are hoping we will be able to come safely back together again soon. You should be in the midst of your first learning packet, and don’t worry if you have some questions because your teachers are there to help. Please contact your child’s teacher via email or phone if you have any questions. Many classes have already had their first Zoom meeting. It will be a process to figure all of this out and we will be fine tuning as we go through this month. Please be patient, we will get through this interesting time together.

The next packet will be going out this Friday, April 3rd. We are trying a drive through process this time and hope it will save parents from having to get out of the car. Please be careful and considerate of other drivers and as always, please do not block the driveway entrance if there happens to be a line. You can drive through anytime between 9:00 am -12:00 pm. We will have tables set up at the top of the driveway. You will pick-up your packets and drive down the far ramp to exit.

Next week, April 6-10 is Spring Break. I know we may not be able to travel, but I hope the weather is nice enough to get outside and enjoy our beautiful rural surroundings. We miss you and please take care of one another.

p.a: Tobacco, Vaping and Marijuana: A Parent’s Guide to a New Epidemic
Clear Creek Safety Information for Parents
